intro: Boehmeria zollingeriana var. latifolia, commonly known as broadleaf nettle or Chinese nettle, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many species of stinging plants. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves with a dense covering of fine hairs. It produces small, greenish flowers arranged in clusters, and it is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage. The leaves are also used in traditional medicine and as a source of fiber.
